newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Santos administrative portworkers to stop work Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Santos administrative portworkers to stop work Tuesday.

text.p: Administrative portworkers at the key Brazilian port of Santos plan to halt work at 0100 local/0400 GMT in protest at not being consulted about a switch to 24-hour operations at the port, they said in a statement.
It was not clear how long the stoppage would last. No one at the Administrative Portworkers' Union was immediately available to give further details of the action.
Santos port authority Codesp earlier this month announced it would switch to operating 24 hours a day as of June 30, allowing a faster transit of cargoes and creating cost savings for users.
The administrative union said that although it agreed with the measure in principle, it was protesting against Codesp's failure to discuss the plan with its members.
Members of the union were due to hold an assembly at 2000 local/2300 GMT.
